tit.e: Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in the Makimuku-kofun Tumuli Cluster)
Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in the Makimuku-kofun Tumuli Cluster)

sen.j: 纒向石塚古墳（まきむく・いしづか・こふん）は纒向古墳群に属する古墳。
sen.e: The Makimuku Ishizuka Kofun is a kofun (ancient tomb) belonging to the Makimuku Kofun Group.
The Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb belonging to the Makimuku-kofun Tumuli Cluster.
The Makimuku Ishizuka-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb belonging to the Makimuku-kofun Tumuli Cluster.

sen.j: 纏向遺跡内では最古の古墳の可能性あり。
sen.e: In the Makimuku ruins it may possibly be the oldest kofun.
In the Makimuku ruins it may possibly be the oldest tumulus.
In the Makimuku ruins it may possibly be the oldest tumulus.

sen.j: また、前方後円墳成立期の古墳として注目されている。
sen.e: Moreover, it has been attracting attention as a zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) in the Zenpokoenfun Formation period.
Moreover, it has been attracting attention as a tumulus in the formation period of a large keyhole-shaped mound.
Moreover, it has been attracting attention as a tumulus in the formation period of a large keyhole-shaped mound.

sen.j: 2006年1月26日、国史跡に指定。
sen.e: On January 26, 2006 it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 26, 2006 it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 26, 2006 it was designated as a national historic site.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 所在地：奈良県桜井市太田字石塚
sen.e: Location: Aza Ishizuka, Ota, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Aza Ishizuka, Ota, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Aza Ishizuka, Ota, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 被葬者：不明
sen.e: Buried person: Unknown
Buried person: Unknown
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Buried person: Unknown

sen.j: 築造時期：古墳時代前期初頭（3世紀中葉か）
sen.e: Time of construction: The early first half of the Kofun period (possibly in the middle of the 3rd century)
Time of construction: The early first half of the Kofun period (Tumulus period) (possibly in the middle of the third century)
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Time of construction: The early first half of the Kofun period (Tumulus period) (possibly in the middle of the third century)

sen.j: 墳 形：纒向型前方後円墳
sen.e: Tomb shape: A Makinuki type zenpokoenfun,
Tomb shape: A Makinuki type keyhole-shaped mound
Tomb shape: A Makinuki type keyhole-shaped mound

sen.j: 規 模：全長96m、後円部（主丘部）東西59メートル、南北45メートル、不整形円形。
sen.e: Size: 96m in full length,
Size: 96 meters in full length, the back circular part (the main mound) 59 meters from east to west, 45 meters from north to south, irregular circle shaped.
sen.cmt: 原文が不適切に分割されていたため、原文・訳文共に1文にしました。余分なスペースを削除し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: Size: 96 meters in full length, the back circular part (the main mound) 59 meters from east to west, 45 meters from north to south, irregular circle shaped.

sen.j: 前方部長約32m・幅約34m、三味線の撥のように開いている。
sen.e: The front part is about 32m in length and 34m in width, and spread like a shamisen plectrum
The front square part is approximately 32 meters in length and 34 meters in width, and spread like a shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo) plectrum.
sen.cmt: ピリオド、用語補足しました。
sen.e: The front square part is approximately 32 meters in length and 34 meters in width, and spread like a shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo) plectrum.

sen.j: くびれ部幅約12.8m、周濠幅約20m、葺石・埴輪無し。
sen.e: The constricted spot about 12.8m in width, the shugo (loop moat) about 20m in width, no found fukiishi (a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound) and no haniwa (clay figure).

The constricted spot is approximately 12.8 meters in width, the shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 20 meters in width; no fukiishi (a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound) and no haniwa (clay figure) are found.

The constricted spot is approximately 12.8 meters in width, the shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 20 meters in width; no fukiishi (a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound) and no haniwa (clay figure) are found.

sen.j: 埋葬部：
sen.e: Burial spot:
Burial spot:
Burial spot:

sen.j: 墳頂部は太平洋戦争末期に削平され、そこに高射砲か対空機銃の砲台の基礎部分の跡が発見された。
sen.e: The surface of the tomb was flattened out during the end of the Pacific War, and the remains of the base of an antiaircraft gun or an antiaircraft machine gun were found there.
The top of the tomb was flattened out during the end of the Pacific War, and the remains of the base of an antiaircraft gun or an antiaircraft machine gun were found there.
The top of the tomb was flattened out during the end of the Pacific War, and the remains of the base of an antiaircraft gun or an antiaircraft machine gun were found there.

sen.j: 当時埋葬施設及び遺物の出土がないことから後円部の埋葬ではないか、深淵部に埋葬施設があると考えられる。
sen.e: At that time the fact that neither the burial facilities and nor relics were found makes us think that the burial spot might be the back circular part or that the burial facilities might be in the deepest spot of the tomb.

At that time the fact that neither the burial facilities and nor relics were found makes us think that the burial spot might be the back circular part or that the burial facilities might be in the deepest spot of the tomb.

At that time the fact that neither the burial facilities and nor relics were found makes us think that the burial spot might be the back circular part or that the burial facilities might be in the deepest spot of the tomb.

sen.j: 出土遺物：周濠より出土、弥生時代後期最終末期から古墳時代初頭の土器出土。
sen.e: Unearthed goods: Excavated from the shugo, unearthed earthen vessels from the end of the latter half of the Yayoi period to the early Kofun period.
Unearthed goods: Excavated from the shugo, unearthed earthen vessels from the end of the latter half of the Yayoi period to the early Kofun period.
Unearthed goods: Excavated from the shugo, unearthed earthen vessels from the end of the latter half of the Yayoi period to the early Kofun period.

sen.j: 弧紋円盤（こもんえんばん、吉備系の祭祀用遺物）
sen.e: Komonenban (relics of Kibi type goods for religious service)
Komon Enban (relics of Kibi type goods for religious service)
Komon Enban (relics of Kibi type goods for religious service)

sen.e: Vermilion-lacquered chicken-shaped wooden products
Vermilion-lacquered chicken-shaped wooden products
Vermilion-lacquered chicken-shaped wooden products

Yokozuchi (large mallets)

Water tanks

sen.e: Wooden goods such as building components

sen.j: 土師器（纒向I式期）
sen.e: Haji potteries (Makimuku type I period)
